nodes.title: Ollama and Image Text Generation
widgets_values:
Make sure Ollama server is running!

The WAN2.1 is based on qwen2.5 & qwen3. However, we need the VL version of the models (Visual Localization) to utilize the images. Below are two models that can be use. One is quite large:

qwen2.5vl:7b
qwen2.5vl:32b

<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<

https://ollama.com/library/qwen2.5vl

Use "ollama run <LLM name>" in a CMD prompt to download the LLM before use here.
Also a model must not be loaded into Ollama in a CMD window while this runs!

nodes.title: Add number To End Of Name
CLIP Text Encode (Positive Prompt)
widgets_values: No watermarks, no logos, no text

nodes.title: Crop to larger size for inpainting detail
Cropped to 2X size and Squared with Padding
CLIP Text Encode (Positive Prompt)
widgets_values: Fill in the padded or blank area in the image, ensuring the filled portion seamlessly blends with the surrounding content. The filled area should match the texture, colors, and patterns of the existing parts of the image, creating a natural and coherent extension of the scene.

/no_think
You are a top-tier art director, tasked with providing detailed yet concise image descriptions for training using Wan2.1. Craft the text prompt based on inspiration, ensuring it includes these key elements:

Subject: Focus on the human subject's appearance, including hair style, hair color, eye color, direction of head, direction of body, direction of eyes, facial expression, accessories, head direction, body posture, weather they their mouth is open, if you can see their teeth, and clothing details. Mention specific features such as braces, types of hats, and any notable accessories.

Scene: Describe the environment in which the subject is situated, whether real or fictional. Include elements like the foreground, background, lighting, and mood to create a vivid setting.

Action: Detail the subject's movement (or lack thereof), including any subtle or noticeable actions. Specify if the subject is in motion, standing still, or engaging in any specific activity.

All three elementssubject, scene, and actionshould be seamlessly integrated into a single, natural paragraph that flows well in English. Do not use bullet points. The description should be one detailed large cohesive paragraph. Do not add any text that specifies each section by Subject, Action, or Scene. Reference the subject of the image as <USER_SUBJECT>.

nodes.title: Generated Image Description
widgets_values: The image you've provided is a close-up of a person with red hair styled in a side part. The individual is wearing a black top with decorative elements and small earrings. The background appears to be outdoors, with a blurred natural setting. The image seems to be part of a dataset, as indicated by the directory path you've shared, which suggests it might be used for training or analysis in a digital or AI context.

nodes.title: Generated Image Description
widgets_values: The image you've provided is a close-up of a person with red hair styled in a side part. The individual is wearing a black top with decorative elements and small earrings. The background appears to be outdoors, with a blurred natural setting. The image seems to be part of a dataset, as indicated by the directory path you've shared, which suggests it might be used for training or analysis in a digital or AI context.

HOW IT WORKS:

Create two folders. 

1. Close-Up Shots:
has images that are best suited for close up shots such as face. These images are usual above the chest and show the face in large view

2. Body Shots:
These images are anything further down than the chest

These two types of images are handled differently. The close-ups will be first centered on the face, then cropped to it. This ensures that the face is centered in the image and is large. The body shots are instead outpainted. Instead of cropping them down until they fit, the image is expanded outward and AI paints in the padding. This allows the ability to maintain the full body in the image without cutting off the body. Because there are two methods, there are two folders.

The workflow will then combine all of the results of the images in one folder after processing. The workflow will then process all images to embedded their decription. The description of the images uses qwen2.5lv:32b LLM to describe the image in text. This is then embedded into the image as a tEXt chunk. I have written a program that can extract this text simply by dragging one ore more images to it. The resulting text file will have the same name as the image.

The purpose of embedding its description is so that the user does not need to manually keep track of both the image and text file. The user can rename / remove any images from the batch  the when ready extract the text files from them. This will ensure all naming matches and the files and the text files are correct. And if any changes need to be made ater the text files are produced, all the user has to do is drag the updated image list to the program again and it will re-generate the text files.
